business.headline: India's top 7 billionaires lose $34 billion amid stock market slumpMukesh Ambani, India's richest person, lost $3.13 billion this year, though he still remains India's richest man with a net worth of $87.5 billion.

Why are some investors choosing fixed deposits over SIPs?Many stock market experts suggest that mid-cap and small-cap stocks are currently expensive, which has triggered a correction in the last six months.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank share price is rising today after 27% crashIndusIndi Bank stock price: The stock surged nearly 14% from its intraday low, climbing to Rs 690 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), breaking a five-day losing streak.At around 12 pm, shares of the company were up 3.18% to Rs 676.80 on the NSE.

5 billionaires at Trump's swearing-in see over $200 billion vanish in weeks   The start of Donald Trump's second term has been brutal for some of the world's richest billionaires, including those present at his swearing-in ceremony.

Jio and Airtel sign deals with Elon Musk's Starlink for satellite internet in IndiaJio and Airtel have signed separate agreements with Elon Musk's Starlink to bring satellite internet to India. The partnerships aim to provide high-speed broadband to remote and underserved areas. Starlink's service rollout depends on government approval. The deals could improve connectivity for education, healthcare, and businesses in regions lacking fibre-optic infrastructure. Starlink uses a constellation of 6,900 satellites for global broadband coverage.

Reliance shares gain after Jio's deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX for StarlinkRIL shares were up over 1% in early trade but gave up some gains due to market volatility. Around 10 am, the stock was trading 0.35% higher at Rs 1,251.50.
Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Why are major IT stocks falling today?At around 9:50 am, Infosys shares were down 3.5% and Wipro fell over 3.35%. HCLTech was down over 2.4% and TCS tumbled nearly 2%.

Sensex, Nifty swing between gains and losses in volatile session; IT stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex, which was up nearly 300 points in early trade, fell 91.43 points to trade at 74,010.37 around 9:30 am. The Nifty50 also fell 40.60 points to trade at 22,457.30.

After Airtel, Jio signs deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink to IndiaThe partnership aims to expand broadband access across India, especially in remote areas. Jio, which handles more mobile data than any other operator, will use Starlink's satellite network to strengthen its internet services.

Stock market today: Will Trump's latest tariff threat impact Dalal Street today? Stock market opening today: While domestic stocks remain under pressure, experts suggested that Dalal Street is unlikely to feel the impact of the ongoing weakness in US stock markets.

US stock markets remain under pressure after Monday's big crash. 3 things to knowThe S&P 500 dropped as low as 5,528.41, marking a 10% fall from its February 19 record of 6,144.15—hitting what traders call a "market correction."

entertainment.headline: TV actor Aditi Sharma's rumoured boyfriend breaks silence amid infidelity allegationApollena actor Aditi Sharma's co-star Samarthya Gupta has denied rumours of an affair with her, calling the allegations baseless and harmful. Aditi's husband had alleged infidelity.

Kim Sae-ron's unpublished statement emerges after dating rumours with Kim Soo-hyunAlmost a month after South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron's death, her aunt has alleged K-drama star Kim Soo-hyun was in a relationship with Sae-ron, and that they began dating when she was only a minor.

Did Ekta Kapoor just take a jibe at Ram Kapoor in a video about Ozempic?Filmmaker Ekta Kapoor on Tuesday shared a video on Instagram in which she was seen talking about her weight gain and if she should follow artificial methods to lose some weight. There was also a Ram Kapoor connection.

Ibrahim Ali Khan re-posts Nadaaniyan's poor ratings, puzzled fans reactIbrahim Ali Khan reposted his film, Nadaaniyan's low ratings. Fans were puzzled by the actor's move in highlighting the film's poor performance.

Singer Ne-Yo introduces his four girlfriends from his polyamorous relationship In a candid revelation, American singer and songwriter Ne-Yo introduced his four girlfriends, embracing a polyamorous lifestyle. The musician shared insights into his unique relationship dynamic online, calling it his 'pyramid'.

Tapu-Sonu wedding in Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah…? Fans say 'must be Bhide's dream'A promo of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah shows Tapu marrying Sonu, leaving fans in shock. Many speculate it's a dream sequence, as Bhide disapproves of Tapu. The sitcom, India's longest-running, first aired in 2008.

Exclusive: Louis Tomlinson on India debut, love for Indian food, and solo career Louis Tomlinson, former One Direction member, embarked on his first solo performance in India at Lollapalooza 2025. He expressed excitement and a fondness for Indian culture, particularly its cuisine, during an exclusive interview.

Telugu actor-politician Posani Krishna Murali granted bail in all casesActor and YSRCP member Posani Krishna Murali has been granted bail in all cases. The YSRCP accused Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu-led government of filing 17 cases against him as part of a political vendetta.

SRK, Aishwarya Rai top contenders to replace Amitabh Bachchan on KBC: StudyAccording to a recent study conducted among fans, actors Shah Rukh Khan and Aishwarya Rai are the top picks to replace megastar Amitabh Bachchan on his game show Kaun Banega Crorepati.

Louis Tomlinson on first India visit, solo career, Lollapalooza, love for Indian food | Exclusive Former One Direction member Louis Tomlinson finally arrives in India! In this exclusive chat with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, he talks about his long-awaited visit, his excitement for Lollapalooza, and his deep love for Indian food (yes, he tried butter chicken!).

Daredevil Born Again breaks streaming records with 7.5 million views Latest Marvel series, Daredevil Born Again, has set a new streaming record with 7.5 million views in just five days. The series marks the return of Charlie Cox as Daredevil, alongside a mix of returning and new cast members.
American rock band Guns N' Roses to return to India after 12 years American rock band Guns N' Roses will return to India after 12 years. They will perform in Mumbai on May 17.

Kim Soo-hyun denies 'baseless' relationship claims with late actor Kim Sae-ronActor Kim Soo-hyun and his agency Gold Medalist have rejected allegations made by the YouTube channel Garosero Research Institute. The accusations suggest a past relationship with the late Kim Sae-ron and blame the agency for her financial woes.

KKK 14's Aditi Sharma heads for divorce, husband alleges infidelity in 4 monthsTV actor Aditi Sharma's marital bliss was short-lived as her husband Abhineet Kaushik accused her of cheating. This comes just four months after their secret wedding on November 12, 2024.

Mallika Sherawat in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15: ReportMallika Sherawat is reportedly in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15. While her participation isn't confirmed, she recently returned to Bollywood and is now looking for her next big project.

Dhanashree Verma restores photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid rumours of divorceDhanashree Verma restored Instagram photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid divorce rumours. While her lawyer confirmed court proceedings, her family denied claims of a Rs 60 crore alimony demand.

Udit Narayan mocks the kiss row at 'Pintu Ki Pappi' eventVeteran playback singer Udit Narayan opened up about the viral kiss incident a month after backlash. He discussed the timeline of the video where he is seen kissing his female fans.

You 5 trailer: Penn Badgeley's Joe Goldberg returns for a killer finaleThe trailer for You Season 5 is out, showcasing the last chapter of Joe Goldberg's saga. Streaming starts April 24 on Netflix, with Joe facing past demons.
South Korean singer Wheesung found dead at 43Popular South Korean soloist Wheesung was found dead at his home on Monday. The authorities are still investigating the matter.

Meghan Markle's father criticises her show, mocks her for putting flowers on food Meghan Markle's estranged father, Thomas Markle, talked about her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan', in an interview. He called her 'fake', and mentioned that she should have had a more relatable show for women who are not privileged like her.

Surreal and magical: Singer Lisa Mishra on sharing stage with Ed SheeranSinger Lisa Mishra performed the opening act for British singer Ed Sheeran during his concert in India earlier this year. Speaking exclusively to India Today Digital, the 31-year-old reflected on her experience of the same. Additionally, she opened up about working with Ananya Panday in Call Me Bae.

Badshah's weight-loss video stuns fans, internet thinks he looks like AP DhillonA recent video of Badshah has left fans stunned by his physical transformation. While promoting his new clothing brand, he showcased his new look, prompting fans to compare him to fellow Punjabi singer and rapper AP Dhillon.

When Life Gives You Tangerines review:  IU, Park Bo-gum's series is a must-watchReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025In When Life Gives You Tangerines, IU and Park Bo-gum deliver mesmerising performances in a story that spans decades. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Jeju, this K-drama explores themes of love, endurance, and the quiet strength of women.

Actor Helly Shah on TV's future: We need to up our gameActor Helly Shah talks about her comedy debut, TV's regressive content, and her Bollywood aspirations. She also shares that she dreams of playing bold and tough roles.

Lollapalooza Day 2: Green Day, Louis Tomlinson, Aurora make thunderous India debutMumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse became the epicentre of music as Lollapalooza India 2025 wrapped up Day 2. From Green Day's electrifying debut to indie rock and soulful serenades, it was a night of musical magic.

Security sought for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's 'teach her a lesson' remarkAn association seeking rights for natives of Karnataka's Coorg (Kodagu) region, Codava National Council, urged the state authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the council, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

As per reports, the US has asked India to remove tariffs on nearly all goods except agricultural products.

How Jinnah's betrayal sparked Baloch freedom movementBalochistan has seen periods of active rebellion for independence from Pakistan. It was the betrayal and merger of Kalat, a princely state in what is now Balochistan, into Pakistan by Muhammad Ali Jinnah that is one of the causes of the fierce battle for independence by the Baloch people.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
